Package sprites

Class Player

java.lang.Object
sprites.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameVariables
public class Player extends Object implements GameVariables

Player holds character attributes including images, state (Idle, Move...), facing (N, NE, E...) and methods including loading images, updating state, and drawing.

Since:
March 20, 2024
Author:
Andrew Denegar, Nick Clouse, Molly O'Connor
See Also:
  • GameVariables

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface gameTools.GameVariables

    GameVariables.Facing, GameVariables.State

    • Player

      public Player()

  • Method Details

    • load_display_images

      public void load_display_images(String character_name)
      For the display, we only need to load a subset of the total images.
      Parameters:
      character_name - the name of the character to be loaded.

    • load_images

      public void load_images(String character_name)
      Load images for each player state.
      Parameters:
      character_name - the name of the player file to be selected (Civilian1, Civilian2, Civilian1(black), etc).

    • set_final_attack_images

      public void set_final_attack_images()
      Set the final attack images to determine when the animation should stop.

    • load_spritesheet

      private void load_spritesheet(String character_name, GameVariables.State playerState, int xDim, int yDim)
      Load an individual spritesheet.
      Parameters:
      character_name - the name of the player file to be selected (Civilian1, Civilian2, Civilian1(black), etc).
      playerState - the player state that is to be loaded.
      xDim - the x dimension of the spritesheet.
      yDim - the y dimension of the spritesheet.

    • load_dead_image

      private void load_dead_image(String character_name)
      Loads dead image for player.
      Parameters:
      character_name - Name of character.

    • attacking

      public void attacking()
      Checks if the player hits any enemies when they attack. Uses the attack hitboxes and enemy hitbox to make rectangles and check for collision between the two. If there is a collision, add the enemy to hit enemies set.

    • handleAttack

      public void handleAttack()
      Handles the player attack and knocks back all enemies the player hit.

    • hitEnemies

      public boolean hitEnemies()
      Checks if any enemies are in hitEnemies Set.
      Returns:
      If any enemies are in hitEnemies Set.

    • updateState

      public void updateState(boolean up, boolean down, boolean right, boolean left)
      Update the direction that our player is facing.
      Parameters:
      up - The up arrow key is pressed.
      down - The down arrow key is pressed.
      right - The right arrow key is pressed.
      left - The left arrow key is pressed.

    • getState

      public String getState()
      Returns:
      currentState in string format.

    • getFacing

      public String getFacing()
      Returns:
      currentFacing in string format.

    • setFacing

      public void setFacing(GameVariables.Facing direction)
      Change the direction the player is facing.
      Parameters:
      direction - to set.

    • setState

      public void setState(GameVariables.State playerState)
      Change the state of the player.
      Parameters:
      playerState - to set.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g)
      Draw our player. Draw handles the switching from one image in a sequence to the next.
      Parameters:
      g - 2Dgraphics to draw on.

    • draw_display

      public void draw_display(Graphics2D g)
      Draw the player for the home screen player display.
      Parameters:
      g - The Graphics2D object to be drawn with.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset player state and direction.

    • resetDrawCount

      public void resetDrawCount()
      Set the drawcount back to zero.

    • isStateLocked

      public boolean isStateLocked()
      Return whether or not the player's state is currently locked.
      Returns:
      boolean true or false.

    • isFacingLocked

      public boolean isFacingLocked()
      Return whether or not the player's direction is currently locked.
      Returns:
      boolean true or false.

    • lockState

      public void lockState()
      Set the state to be fixed.

      Set facing to be fixed.

    • isGettingAttacked

      public boolean isGettingAttacked()
      While the player is being hit by an enemy, this will return true.
      Returns:
      boolean if the player is getting attacked.

    • setGettingAttacked

      public void setGettingAttacked(boolean t)
      Set whether or not the player is attacking.
      Parameters:
      t - boolean true to set the player to be attacking and false to be not attacking.

    • initializeGUI

      public static void initializeGUI()
      Initialize a basic GUI for testing.

      public String get_character_name()

      Returns:
      our character's name
